info.title: S2, the durable streams API
info.description: Streams as a cloud storage primitive.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Filter to access tokens whose ID begins with this prefix.

parameters.name: start_after
parameters.description: Filter to access tokens whose ID lexicographically starts after this string.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results, up to a maximum of 1000.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Access token ID.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Filter to basins whose names begin with this prefix.

parameters.name: start_after
parameters.description:
Filter to basins whose names lexicographically start after this string.
It must be greater than or equal to the `prefix` if specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results, up to a maximum of 1000.

parameters.description: Client-specified request token for idempotent retries.

Filter to streams whose name begins with this prefix.

parameters.name: s2-format
parameters.description:
Defines the interpretation of record data (header name, header value, and body) with the JSON content type.
Use `raw` (default) for efficient transmission and storage of Unicode data — storage will be in UTF-8.
Use `base64` for safe transmission with efficient storage of binary data.

parameters.name: seq_num
parameters.description: Start from a sequence number.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Start from a timestamp.

parameters.name: tail_offset
parameters.description: Start from number of records before the next sequence number.

parameters.name: clamp
parameters.description:
Start reading from the tail if the requested position is beyond it.
Otherwise, a `416 Range Not Satisfiable` response is returned.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description:
Record count limit.
Non-streaming reads are capped by the default limit of 1000 records.

parameters.name: bytes
parameters.description:
Metered bytes limit.
Non-streaming reads are capped by the default limit of 1 MiB.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Exclusive timestamp to read until.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description:
Duration in seconds to wait for new records.
The default duration is 0 if there is a bound on `count`, `bytes`, or `until`, and otherwise infinite.
Non-streaming reads are always bounded on `count` and `bytes`, so you can achieve long poll semantics by specifying a non-zero duration up to 60 seconds.
In the context of an SSE or S2S streaming read, the duration will bound how much time can elapse between records throughout the lifetime of the session.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: Stream name.

parameters.name: s2-format
parameters.description:
Defines the interpretation of record data (header name, header value, and body) with the JSON content type.
Use `raw` (default) for efficient transmission and storage of Unicode data — storage will be in UTF-8.
Use `base64` for safe transmission with efficient storage of binary data.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: Stream name.

auto_prefix_streams.description:
Namespace streams based on the configured stream-level scope, which must be a prefix.
Stream name arguments will be automatically prefixed, and the prefix will be stripped when listing streams.

expires_at.description:
Expiration time in RFC 3339 format.
If not set, the expiration will be set to that of the requestor's token.

id.description:
Access token ID.
It must be unique to the account and between 1 and 96 bytes in length.

oneOf.description: Access permissions at operation group level.

ops.description:
Operations allowed for the token.
A union of allowed operations and groups is used as an effective set of allowed operations.

interval.description: The interval at which data points are accumulated.

values.description:
Timeseries values.
Each element is a tuple of a timestamp in Unix epoch seconds and a data point.
The data point represents the accumulated value for the time period starting at the timestamp, spanning one `interval`.

end.description:
Sequence number of the last record that was appended `+ 1`, and timestamp of the last record that was appended.
The difference between `end.seq_num` and `start.seq_num` will be the number of records appended.

start.description: Sequence number and timestamp of the first record that was appended.

tail.description:
Sequence number that will be assigned to the next record on the stream, and timestamp of the last record on the stream.
This can be greater than the `end` position in case of concurrent appends.

oneOf.title: fencing token
oneOf.description:
Fencing token did not match.
The expected fencing token is returned.

fencing_token_mismatch.description:
Fencing token did not match.
The expected fencing token is returned.

oneOf.title: seq num
oneOf.description:
Sequence number did not match the tail of the stream.
The expected next sequence number is returned.

seq_num_mismatch.description:
Sequence number did not match the tail of the stream.
The expected next sequence number is returned.

AppendConditionFailed.description: Aborted due to a failed condition.

oneOf.description: Enforce a fencing token, which starts out as an empty string that can be overridden by a `fence` command record.
Enforce that the sequence number assigned to the first record matches.

records.description:
Batch of records to append atomically, which must contain at least one record, and no more than 1000.
The total size of a batch of records may not exceed 1 MiB of metered bytes.

AppendRecord.description: Record to be appended to a stream.

headers.description: Series of name-value pairs for this record.

oneOf.description:
Timestamp for this record.
The service will always ensure monotonicity by adjusting it up if necessary to the maximum observed timestamp.
Refer to stream timestamping configuration for the finer semantics around whether a client-specified timestamp is required, and whether it will be capped at the arrival time.

create_stream_on_append.description: Create stream on append if it doesn't exist, using the default stream configuration.

create_stream_on_read.description: Create stream on read if it doesn't exist, using the default stream configuration.

basin.description:
Basin name which must be globally unique.
It can be between 8 and 48 bytes in length, and comprise lowercase letters, numbers and hyphens.
It cannot begin or end with a hyphen.

oneOf.description:
Basin scope.
This cannot be reconfigured.

stream.description:
Stream name that is unique to the basin.
It can be between 1 and 512 bytes in length.

min_age_secs.description:
Minimum age in seconds before an empty stream can be deleted.
Set to 0 (default) to disable delete-on-empty (don't delete automatically).

Minimum age in seconds before an empty stream can be deleted.
Set to 0 to disable delete-on-empty (don't delete automatically).

values.description:
Timeseries values.
Each element is a tuple of a timestamp in Unix epoch seconds and a data point.
The data point represents the value at the instant of the timestamp.

items.description:
Headers add structured information to a record as name-value pairs.

The name cannot be empty, with the exception of an S2 command record.

Header.description:
Headers add structured information to a record as name-value pairs.

The name cannot be empty, with the exception of an S2 command record.

has_more.description: Indicates that there are more access tokens that match the criteria.
Indicates that there are more basins that match the criteria.
Indicates that there are more results that match the criteria.

oneOf.description: Named series of `(timestamp, value)` points representing an accumulation over a specified interval.

accumulation.description: Named series of `(timestamp, value)` points representing an accumulation over a specified interval.

oneOf.description: Named series of `(timestamp, value)` points each representing an instantaneous value.

gauge.description: Named series of `(timestamp, value)` points each representing an instantaneous value.

records.description:
Records that are durably sequenced on the stream, retrieved based on the requested criteria.
This can only be empty in response to a unary read (i.e. not SSE), if the request cannot be satisfied without violating an explicit bound (`count`, `bytes`, or `until`).

oneOf.description:
Sequence number that will be assigned to the next record on the stream, and timestamp of the last record.
This will only be present when reading recent records.

oneOf.title: exact
oneOf.description:
Match only the resource with this exact name.
Use an empty string to match no resources.

exact.description:
Match only the resource with this exact name.
Use an empty string to match no resources.

oneOf.title: prefix
oneOf.description:
Match all resources that start with this prefix.
Use an empty string to match all resource.

prefix.description:
Match all resources that start with this prefix.
Use an empty string to match all resource.

oneOf.description:
Age in seconds for automatic trimming of records older than this threshold.
This must be set to a value greater than 0 seconds.

age.description:
Age in seconds for automatic trimming of records older than this threshold.
This must be set to a value greater than 0 seconds.

SequencedRecord.description: Record that is durably sequenced on a stream.

headers.description: Series of name-value pairs for this record.

seq_num.description: Sequence number assigned by the service.

oneOf.description:
Retention policy for the stream.
If unspecified, the default is to retain records for 7 days.

deleted_at.description: Deletion time in RFC 3339 format, if the stream is being deleted.

StreamPosition.description: Position of a record in a stream.

seq_num.description: Sequence number assigned by the service.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp, which may be client-specified or assigned by the service.
If it is assigned by the service, it will represent milliseconds since Unix epoch.

oneOf.description:
Retention policy for the stream.
If unspecified, the default is to retain records for 7 days.

tail.description: Sequence number that will be assigned to the next record on the stream, and timestamp of the last record.

oneOf.description: Timestamping mode for appends that influences how timestamps are handled.

uncapped.description:
Allow client-specified timestamps to exceed the arrival time.
If this is `false` or not set, client timestamps will be capped at the arrival time.

oneOf.description: Timestamping mode for appends that influences how timestamps are handled.

uncapped.description: Allow client-specified timestamps to exceed the arrival time.

access_token.description: Bearer authentication header of the form `Bearer <token>`, where `<token>` is your access token.
